channel.title: Latest Finextra Research Security Headlines
channel.description: The Latest Financial IT Security Headlines

item.title: Swedish central bank files police report after IT firm hit by ransomware attack
item.description: Sweden's Riksbank has filed a police report after a ransomware attack on software firm Tietoevry knocked out some of the central bank's IT systems.

item.title: Mastercard bids to kill passwords with new biometric service
item.description: Mastercard is hoping to consign passwords to the history books with a new biometric authentication service.

item.title: Venmo, Zelle and Cash App leave users vulnerable to fraud - Manhattan DA
item.description: Manhattan's district attorney has written to the firms behind Venmo, Zelle and the Cash App, calling on them to up their security measures in the face of growing fraud.

item.title: Tink launches risk engine to unlock instant payments
item.description: Open banking platform Tink has launched a rules-based risk engine to protect merchants from fraud on instant payment rails.

item.title: Scams to drive complaints to UK's Financial Ombudsman Service
item.description: The UK's Financial Ombudsman Service is expecting more than 181,000 consumer complaints in the next year, driven in part by an increase in financial fraud and scams.

item.title: BaFin increases focus on IT outsourcing risks
item.description: Cybersecurity and the outsourcing of IT services are among the greatest risks to the financial sector, warns a new report from German regulator BaFin.

item.title: SEC says SIM swap attack behind X hack
item.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission says a "SIM swap" attack was to blame for the hack on its X account earlier this month.

item.title: Hong Kong banks take on SMS scammers
item.description: Hong Kong banks are joining an SMS sender registration scheme designed to help customers avoid falling for scam texts.

item.title: NAB and Microsoft deliver cyber assessment tool for SMEs
item.description: National Australia Bank has teamed with Microsoft to deliver a free cyber assessment tool to help Aussie small businesses prepare for and bounce back from a cyber attack.

item.title: TSB finds over a third of adverts on Facebook Marketplace could be scams
item.description: TSB is advising consumers to avoid making online purchases on Facebook Marketplace, warning that over a third (34%) of the adverts tested on the platform are scam posts.

item.title: Hawk AI hires HSBC vet Shearer
item.description: German RegTech Hawk AI has brought in HSBC compliance veteran Michael Shearer as chief solution officer.

item.title: JPMorgan faces rising number of hacking attempts
item.description: JPMorgan Chase has seen the number of hacking attempts on its systems soar over the last year.

item.title: Bold Commerce unveils biometric checkout
item.description: Bold Commerce, the headless checkout company for leading omnichannel retailers and DTC brands, today announced the launch of its first biometric checkout powered by Wink.

item.title: Fed working group issues scam definition
item.description: The year-over-year losses from scams continue to rise. In 2022, the Federal Trade Commission (Off-site) reported $8.8 billion in losses from scam activity, a 30% increase from the previous year.

item.title: Global ransomware threat expected to rise with AI, NCSC warns
item.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) is expected to increase the global ransomware threat over the next two years cyber chiefs have warned in a new report published today (Wednesday).

item.title: Ingenico builds smartPOS device on Cybersource fraud management platform
item.description: Ingenico, a global leader in payment acceptance and services, has announced a strategic partnership with Cybersource, Visa’s agnostic global payment and fraud management platform.

item.title: Seon welcomes Björn Heckel as CTO
item.description: SEON, the leading end-to-end fraud prevention and AML platform helping companies mitigate fraud and safeguard against revenue threats, today announced the expansion of its executive leadership with the appointment of Björn Heckel as Chief Technology Officer.

item.title: BIS Innovation Hub discloses first six projects for 2024 work programme
item.description: The Bank for International Settlements (BIS) today announced the first batch of six new projects in its 2024 Innovation Hub work programme, including experimentations on cyber security, fighting financial crime, central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) and green finance.

item.title: Fidesmo integrates to Mastercard’s Token Connect and partners with German neobank VIMpay
item.description: Fidesmo, a leader in providing secure and convenient contactless services, is proud to announce the successful completion of its integration between Fidesmo Pay and Mastercard’s Token Connect service, also known as MDES Token Connect.

item.title: Fingerprints releases reusable enrollment device for biometric payment cards
item.description: World-leading biometrics company Fingerprint Cards AB (Fingerprints™) today announces the launch of Smart´Nroll, a simple and reusable enrollment device for biometric payment cards.

item.title: VoPay unveils instant micro-transaction service for bank account verification
item.description: VoPay, a leading provider of embedded financial technology solutions, has launched VoPay Verify, an Instant Bank Account Verification solution via microtransactions – pioneering the first-of-its-kind service in Canada and the United States.

item.title: Wirex bids to combat Dark Web and money mule threats
item.description: Wirex, a leading Web3 money platform, announced a significant enhancement in its measures to combat Dark Web activities and money mule threats.

item.title: Socure grows leadership team
item.description: Socure, the leading provider of artificial intelligence for digital identity verification, sanction screening and fraud prevention, today announced the arrival of three new executives to continue its momentum into 2024.

item.title: Mitek appoints David Lyle as CFO
item.description: Mitek Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ: MITK, Mitek or the Company), a global leader in digital identity and fraud prevention is pleased to announce the appointment of David Lyle as Chief Financial Officer (CFO).

item.title: Securing digital transactions: The global shift towards embedded payments
item.description: Jennifer Marriner, Global Head of Acceptance at Mastercard, discusses how tokenization and embedded experiences are enhancing the digital checkout process in the year ahead. Focusing on the global rollout of solution technologies, such as Mastercard’s ‘Click to Pay,’ we tackle the concerns raised from fragmented customer experiences and how they are being addressed. We hear how physical payments are shaping the standard for online transactions, and how innovations like biometric authentication are refining seamless payments and strengthening security in the upcoming year.

item.title: Upcoming changes in PSD3: The impact on 3DS ACS solutions
item.description: Yogesh Patel, CTO at Outseer, discusses the impact of new PSD3 regulations on 3DS solutions, what should be front of mind for issuers as a result and what to expect from the VISA & Mastercard protocol updates. We hear how data science plays a role with 3DS solutions, the key capabilities to expect from an ACS and how consortium data can help catch more fraud, specifically for CNP transactions.

item.title: Concepts to commercialisation: Growing digital assets
item.description: In the lead up to Singapore Fintech Festival, Lee Zhu Kuang, Chief Digital, Data and Innovation Officer for Securities Services, HSBC, evaluates the transformative impact of tokenisation and the role of AI standardisation in enhancing scalability and interoperability. We discuss the impact of digital assets and the need to balance financial expertise, regulatory compliance, custody services, and investor security for sustainable industry growth.

item.title: Disrupting Financial Crime with RegTech
item.description: Costing up to $3.5 trillion annually, global financial crime demands an innovative response. By accelerating solution deployment and enhancing industry standards, Deborah Young, CEO of The RegTech Association, looks to education initiatives and collaboration to address the issue; setting the stage for the 'Regulatory Public Infrastructure' panel at this week’s Singapore FinTech Festival.

item.title: Advancing ESG practices through tech infrastructure & clearer regulations
item.description: Dr Darian McBain, Chief Executive Officer of Outsourced Chief Sustainability Officer Asia, explores the role of technology infrastructure and the need for clearer regulations to advance ESG practices. We evaluate the impact of payment rails and highlight how seamless cross-border transactions in countries like Singapore, India, and Thailand, contribute to social inclusion by addressing challenges faced by migrants. The discussion also touches on the upcoming ESG debate at this year’s Singapore Fintech Festival, where teams will weigh the possibility of the next trillion being green.

item.title: Regulatory challenges with AI require a collaborative response
item.description: Jo Ann Barefoot, Founder & Chief Executive Officer of Alliance for Innovative Regulation (AIR), discusses the challenges presented by rapidly evolving AI in the global banking landscape and examines the pace of regulatory response. In the lead up to Singapore Fintech Festival 2023, the discussion covers ethical AI innovation, the risks associated with fraud and bias, and the potential role of AI assistants in consumer protection. Jo emphasizes the importance of regulators adopting cloud technology and AI, highlighting the significance of collaborative efforts among stakeholders to navigate the intricacies of AI in banking.

item.title: Shaping Lithuania's next-generation of digital public infrastructure
item.description: Karolis Zemaitis, Vice-Minister, Ministry of the Economy & Innovation, Republic of Lithuania, explores Lithuania's next-generation digital public infrastructure, focusing on scalability, inclusivity, and investment, while tackling security and privacy concerns. The discussion includes Web3 technologies and addresses the challenges of interoperability and the global ecosystem's paradox of balancing dependence and resilience. All within the context of fostering fair and open trade driven by technology, in preparation for Singapore Fintech Festival 2023.

item.title: Navigating payments interoperability in the digital economy
item.description: Camilla Bullock, Chief Executive Officer for Emerging Payments Association Asia, delves into the role of payments interoperability in the digital economy and its facilitation of global trade ahead of Singapore Fintech Festival 2023. Together we explore the challenges linked to interoperability, from technical and regulatory hurdles, to privacy concerns and liability risks, along with the importance of accessibility and trust to achieving seamless payments in an interoperable network.

item.title: Managing compliance complexity with emerging technologies
item.description: At Sibos 2023, David White, Vice President Product, Financial Crime Compliance and Payments, LexisNexis® Risk Solutions, updates us on the areas affected by increased sanction screenings and the technologies organizations are using to address these issues.

item.title: The Perfect Payments Storm
item.description: At Sibos 2023, Dalbir Sahota, Senior Director, Product Management, LexisNexis® Risk Solutions, and Ed Metzger, Vice President, Payments, LexisNexis® Risk Solutions, discuss the financial industry's response to rising sanctions, the impact on banks and FIs correspondent networks, and the benefits of early sanction screenings in the payments process.

item.title: How can Financial Market Infrastructures advance the adoption of DLT?
item.description: At Sibos 2023, Jennifer Peve, Managing Director, Global Head of Strategy and Innovation, DTCC, discusses how Financial Market Infrastructures can help drive digitization, through the development of standards, interoperability, and balancing innovation with safety in an expanding digital asset ecosystem.

item.title: Pushing Fraud Controls to the Next Level
item.description: Isabel Schmidt, Co-Head of Global Payments Products, BNY Mellon, joins us at EBAday 2023 to discuss real-time payments and the ways to improve fraud controls with data validation services and cross-industry collaboration.

item.title: Implementing EBA's Pan-European Fraud Taxonomy: First Findings from Early Movers
item.description: Thomas Egner, Secretary General, Euro Banking Association, and Annick Moes, Head of Industry Issues and Cooperation Initiatives, Euro Banking Association, discuss at EBAday 2023 the practical impact of the EBA's pan-European taxonomies addressing KYC and fraud combatting. They share feedback from first movers, which have implemented the EBA Fraud Taxonomy for fraud analytics and customer education, and comment on the taxonomy’s increasing relevance in the context of evolving payments regulation at EU level.

item.title: Payment processors: Find the one you really love
item.description: This webinar explores how financial institutions (FIs) and fintechs can find a payment processor that meets their needs and expectations.

item.title: Scams: The 2024 Fraud Outlook
item.description: Watch this webinar predicting what financial crime challenges will emerge in 2024 and how financial institutions can tackle them.

item.title: Consumer data privacy: Why protecting trust is essential
item.description: Watch this webinar, hosted in association with Mastercard, to explore how data and privacy has evolved in the payments industry due to digital transformation, and how banks are implementing innovative security measures to maintain customer trust.

item.title: DORA: The drive towards better operational resilience
item.description: Watch this webinar, in association with NTT DATA, on why operational resilience is an essential part of the digital financial system.

item.title: Network Analytics: How to Uncover Financial Crime Risk
item.description: Watch this webinar on the importance of network analytics with financial crime and compliance organisations, and best practices for deploying this technology.
